00001 #include <iostream>
00002 #include <cstdlib>
00003 #include <string>
00004 #include <string.h>
00005 #include <sys/types.h>
00006 #include <sys/socket.h>
00007 #include <netinet/in.h>
00008 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00009 #include <unistd.h>
00010 #include <fcntl.h>
00011 #include <errno.h>
00012 #include <boost/lexical_cast.hpp>
00013 #include "Error.hpp"
00014 #include "Socket.hpp"
00015 
00016 static void handleClient(Socket&);
00017 
00022 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00023 {
00024    std::string USAGE("Usage: testSrv <server port>\n");
00025    ErrIf( argc < 2 ).info(USAGE);
00026 
00027    // Convert the port number arg to an int
00028    in_port_t port;
00029    ErrIfCatch(boost::bad_lexical_cast,
00030               port = boost::lexical_cast<in_port_t>( argv[1] ))
00031              .info("%s is not a port number!\n",argv[1]);
00032    
00033    // Put the supplied ip addr into the sockaddr_in struct, we will reuse this
00034    // memory later to store client addresses in it as they connect.
00035    sockaddr_in addr;
00036    memset( &addr, 0, sizeof(addr) );
00037    addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00038    addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);  // Wildcard address kernel picks best bind     
00039    addr.sin_port = htons(port);
00040       
00041    
00042    //** Get the server to accept stage
00043    Socket sock;
00044    SysErrIf( (sock=socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == -1 );
00045    SysErrIf( bind(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr), sizeof(addr)) == -1 );
00046    SysErrIf( listen(sock, 5) == -1 );
00047    
00048    //** Forever accept new connections and reply
00049    for( ;; ) {
00050      Socket cliSock;
00051      memset( &addr, 0, sizeof(addr) );
00052      socklen_t len = sizeof(addr);
00053      SysErrIf( (cliSock=accept(sock,reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr),&len)) == -1 );
00054      
00055      char cliName[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
00056      WarnIf( inet_ntop(AF_INET, &addr, cliName, sizeof(cliName) ) == 0 );
00057      std::cout << "CONNECTED to: " << ((cliName)?cliName:"Unknown") 
00058                << ":" << addr.sin_port << "\n";
00059      
00060      handleClient( cliSock );
00061   
00062    }
00063    
00064    return 0;
00065 }
00066 
00067 
00074 void handleClient( Socket& cliSock ) {
00075 
00076    size_t rnb, total;
00077    static char buf[1020];  // Hack! This is not 1024, just so when the client sends
00078                            // that number of bytes, the recv call below won't block
00079                            // and screw things up.
00080 
00081    while( 1 ) {
00082       total = 0;
00083       while ( (rnb=recv(cliSock,buf,sizeof(buf),0)) == 1020 ) {
00084          total += rnb;
00085       }
00086       total += rnb;
00087       if ( total == 0 ) return;
00088       
00089       std::cout << "    RECIEVED " << total << " bytes\n"; 
00090 
00091       size_t snb = htonl(total);
00092       WarnIf( (snb=send(cliSock, &snb, sizeof(snb), 0)) == -1 );
00093    } 
00094 }
